intro: Maerua racemulosa, commonly known as the African glorybower, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters. The plant produces showy, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Maerua racemulosa is well adapted to drought conditions and is often used in traditional medicine.
